title: and for the purpose of giving full effect to Regulation (EC) No. 391/2009 of
heading: 2. The European Communities
text_raw:
2. The European Communities 

and Survey 
Organisations) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 275 of 2011) (amended by the 
European Union (Ship Inspection and Survey Organisations) (Amendment) 
Regulations 2015 (S.I. No. 140 of 2015)) are amended in Regulation 2(1) by 
the substitution of the following definition for the definition of “EC 
Regulation”: 

Inspection 

(Ship 

“ ‘EC Regulation’ means Regulation (EC) No. 391/2009 of the 
European Parliament and of the Council of 23 April 20091, as amended 
by Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) No. 1355/2014 of 17 
December 20144, Regulation (EU) 2019/492 of 
the European 
Parliament and of the Council of 25 March 20192 and Regulation (EU) 
2019/1243 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 20 June 
20193;”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

24 March, 2021. 

EAMON RYAN, 

Minister for Transport. 

1 OJ No. L. 131, 28.5.2009, p. 11

4 OJ No. L. 365, 19.12.2014, p. 82 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 30th March, 2021.

title: and for the purpose of giving full effect to Regulation (EC) No. 391/2009 of
heading: (This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

The purpose of these Regulations is to amend the definition of “EC 
Regulation” in the European Communities (Ship Inspection and Survey 
Organisations) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 275 of 2011), as amended, to take 
into account the adoption on 25 March 2019 of Regulation (EU) 2019/492 
amending Regulation (EC) No 391/2009 with regard to the withdrawal of the 
United Kingdom from the Union and the revision of the assessment 
arrangements for recognised organisations, as well as the adoption of 
Regulation (EU) 2019/1243 of 20 June 2019. 

 
 
 
 
 
 4 [138]
